skill.name: web-cli-teleport
skill.description: Guide users on when to use Claude Code Web vs CLI and seamlessly teleport sessions between environments
skill.summary: Guide users on when to use Claude Code Web vs CLI and seamlessly teleport sessions between environme...
skill.author: DNYoussef

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown guidance and a Graphviz flowchart. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system modifications. Static findings are all false positives: hash strings misinterpreted as cryptographic algorithms, documentation backticks as shell execution, and task analysis text as system reconnaissance.

content.value_statement: Users often struggle to decide between Claude Code Web and CLI interfaces. This skill analyzes task complexity, location, and requirements to recommend the best interface and guides seamless session teleportation when needs change.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes task complexity, iteration needs, and user location to recommend optimal interface
Provides decision matrix comparing Web and CLI capabilities, strengths, and limitations
Guides users through session teleportation protocol from Web to CLI
Presents workflow patterns for mobile planning to desktop implementation
Offers best practices for context preservation and interface switching
limitations: Does not execute commands or modify files - provides guidance only
Cannot perform actual teleportation - user must run teleport command manually
Does not integrate with external tools or APIs

use_cases.title: Plan on mobile, implement on desktop
use_cases.description: Use Claude Code iOS app to plan during commute, then teleport to CLI for implementation

use_cases.title: Quick web fixes with CLI complexity
use_cases.description: Start simple tasks on web for quick wins, teleport to CLI when complexity increases

use_cases.title: Collaborative review workflow
use_cases.description: Initial work on CLI, create PR, team reviews on web, teleport back for revisions

prompt_templates.title: Quick interface question
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to [task description]. Should I use Claude Code Web or CLI?

prompt_templates.title: Task analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Use web-cli-teleport skill to plan approach for implementing [feature] with [requirements]

prompt_templates.title: Mid-task switch
prompt_templates.prompt: I started this on Claude Code Web but it is getting complex. Help me teleport to CLI and continue.

prompt_templates.title: Mobile workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: I am on mobile and need to plan [task]. How can I use Claude Code Web to get started and teleport later?

output_examples.input: I need to translate the landing page to Japanese. Should I use web or CLI?
output: Reasoning: Well-defined, one-off task requiring 1-3 interactions
Steps: Go to claude.ai/code, complete translation, create PR from web
Teleport points: Not needed - task stays simple

output_examples.input: Help me debug a complex authentication issue across multiple services
output: Reasoning: Complex debugging requiring multiple iterations and local testing
Steps: Start local CLI session, use inline diffs, run local tests, debug with full tooling
Teleport points: Not needed - start on CLI for best experience

best_practices: Start simple tasks on web for quick wins, teleport when complexity increases
Always clean git state before teleporting to avoid conflicts
Check context percentage after teleporting to verify full history loaded
anti_patterns: Struggling with CLI limitations on web instead of teleporting early
Teleporting with dirty git state causing conflicts
Starting complex iterative tasks on web when CLI inline diffs would help

faq.question: What is the difference between Claude Code Web and CLI?
faq.answer: Web offers no local setup, works on mobile, includes GitHub PR creation. CLI provides inline diffs, local testing, full file access, and VS Code integration.

faq.question: How does session teleportation preserve context?
faq.answer: The teleport command loads approximately 50 percent of the conversation history, preserving context and previous decisions without re-explaining requirements.

faq.question: Can I teleport from CLI back to Web?
faq.answer: Yes, you can switch back to web for final PR review. Some workflows involve multiple switches between interfaces as task complexity changes.

faq.question: What blocks a successful teleport?
faq.answer: Dirty git state is the main blocker. Stash or commit local changes before running the teleport command to avoid conflicts.

faq.question: Is my data safe during teleportation?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only provides guidance. Session teleportation is a built-in Claude Code feature that securely transfers conversation context.

faq.question: When should I use Claude Code Web over CLI?
faq.answer: Use Web for simple one-off tasks, mobile access, quick fixes, PR creation, and collaborative review. Use CLI for complex debugging, large refactoring, and local testing.
